title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that they are similar or trending up

Two points for comparing how the data is similar by making specific references to the graph.
descriptions: The response does not correctly compare the data trend from 2000 to 2015 for Latin America and the Caribbean to the trend shown for the world using one of the following:
The response correctly compares the data trend from 2000 to 2015 for Latin America and the Caribbean to the trend shown for the world using one of the following:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that high yields produce surplus or traditional practices cannot compete.

Two points for explaining why and how rising trends affect traditional agricultural practices in a region specified on the graph.
descriptions: The response does not correctly use the data for one of the regions shown on the graph to explain one of the following reasons why the trend may have an effect on traditional agricultural practices:
The response correctly uses the data for one of the regions shown on the graph to explain one of the following reasons why the trend may have an effect on traditional agricultural practices:
The response correctly uses the data for one of the regions shown on the graph to explain one of the following reasons why the trend may have an effect on traditional agricultural practices:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that rising grain yields would decrease the death rate and increase population growth.

Two points for explaining how increased grain yields would affect population growth for countries in stage 2 of the demographic transition.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways that changes in grain yields may affect rural populations in countries in stage 2 of the demographic transition:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that changes in grain yields may affect rural populations in countries in stage 2 of the demographic transition:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that changes in grain yields may affect rural populations in countries in stage 2 of the demographic transition:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that types of agricultural practices are not shown in the data.

Two points for explaining how the data in the graph do not show types of agricultural practices.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following limitations of the data in showing the types of agricultural practices used at the regional scale:
The response correctly explains one of the following limitations of the data in showing the types of agricultural practices used at the regional scale:
